General.Name: Coca-Cola Bottlers Japan Holdings Inc
General.Description: Coca-Cola Bottlers Japan Holdings Inc., together with its subsidiaries, engages in the purchase, bottling, packaging, distribution, marketing, and sale of carbonated, coffee, tea-based, mineral water, alcohol, and other soft drinks in Japan. The company offers its products under the Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Real Gold, Georgia, Aquarius, Qoo, Sokenbicha, Huang, and Kochakaden brand names. It also manufactures and sells food products; operates vending machines; distributes and sells alcoholic products; and manufactures, processes, and sells beverage products and office coffee services. In addition, the company provides shared services to support the sales of, nonessential, alcoholic, and dairy beverages, as well as food products; real estate properties on lease; and imports, exports, and sells beverage products, nonessential beverage products, and other beverage products. It sells its products through convenience stores and vending machines. The company was formerly known as Coca-Cola Bottlers Japan Inc. and changed its name to Coca-Cola Bottlers Japan Holdings Inc. in January 2018. Coca-Cola Bottlers Japan Holdings Inc. was incorporated in 1960 and is headquartered in Tokyo, Japan.
